meanings.definition: The inability of an organism to synthesize a particular organic compound required for its growth.
meanings.sent1: The auxotrophy of the plant prevented it from growing properly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the auxotrophy of bacteria to understand their growth limitations.
meanings.sent3: The auxotrophy of the tree made it the pickiest plant in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her auxotrophy for sunlight was like a flower always seeking the sun.
meanings.sent5: The auxotrophy of the fish for clean water was evident in its habitat choice.

meanings.definition: A condition in which an organism requires a specific nutrient in order to grow.
meanings.sent1: The auxotrophy of the bird for worms made it a skilled hunter.
meanings.sent2: Farmers provided extra nutrients to the soil to prevent auxotrophy in the crops.
meanings.sent3: The auxotrophy of the cat for fish treats was well-known in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: His auxotrophy for knowledge was insatiable, always seeking new information.
meanings.sent5: The auxotrophy of the plant for sunlight was evident in its daily movement.
